title-group.article-title: The influence of awareness campaigns on the spread of an infectious disease: a qualitative analysis of a fractional epidemic model

contrib-group.aff: grid.411840.80000 0001 0664 9298Department of Mathematics, Faculty of Sciences and Technology, Cadi Ayyad University, B.P. 549, C.P. 40.000 Marrakesh, Morocco

license.license-p: This article is made available via the PMC Open Access Subset for unrestricted research re-use and secondary analysis in any form or by any means with acknowledgement of the original source. These permissions are granted for the duration of the World Health Organization (WHO) declaration of COVID-19 as a global pandemic.

sec.title: Introduction
Preliminary results
sec.p: In this section, we recall some preliminary definitions of the fractional-order integral, Caputo fractional derivative, and Mittag–Lefller function (see Podlubny 1999), and the references therein). Therefore, we establish, the positivity and boundedness of solutions of the model (3).

sec.title: Definition 1
Definition 2
Definition 3
Lemma 1
sec.p: The proof of this lemma follows immediately from (Lin 2007).

sec.title: Theorem 1
Proof
Equilibria and local stability
Theorem 2
Theorem 3
Proof
Theorem 4
Proof
Global stability
sec.p: This subsection is devoted to the global stability of the two equilibria. To this end, we will use some suitable Lyapunov functions and fractional LaSalle’s invariant principle.

sec.title: Theorem 5
Proof
Theorem 6
Proof
Numerical simulations
Conclusion

notes.title: Author Contributions
notes.p: All authors contributed equally to the writing of this paper. They read and approved the final version of the manuscript.
